info.title: GHKOAT API - BU
info.description: Greatest Home Kit Of All Time!

post.summary: Create Kit Orders - Requests that kits be ordered from the appropriate Kit Vendor
post.description:
## Potential Response Codes + Data

Depending on the input data being sent, there are 3 potential results that will be returned
in the event of a successful call. These scenarios depend on the orders themselves, whether those
orders have previously been sent, and the current status of those orders. 
            
The 3 scenarios are:
            
* All New Orders -- **202 response**
* All Successfully Completed Orders -- **200 response**
* A Mix -- **207 response**
            
Review the Responses for more details

200.description:
All Successfully Completed Orders -- Each kit order’s order details are fulfilled.
All the requested kits have already been shipped.
The body will contain all the shipping information pertaining to those kits.

202.description:
All New Orders -- Each Order requested is new to the system (has not been sent before).
All the requested kits are new and being submitted to the Kit Vendor.
The body will be *empty*.

207.description:
A Mix -- A mix of any of the following statuses: new orders, resubmitted orders (errored or no status),
  and completed orders.
Some requested kits are new and being submitted to the Kit Vendor.
Others may be either already shipped (and not re-submitted to the Kit Vendor), or
previously rejected, and are now being re-submitted to the Kit Vendor.
             
The body will contain all the current information the system has, along with
records denoting things that are being "Resubmitted".

400.description:
There are data validation issues.
The body will contain a list of strings describing each validation error
            
    [
        "Orders[0].Priority: 'Priority' must be between 1 and 10. You entered 0.",
        "Orders[0].OrderDetails[0].Quantity: 'Quantity' must be greater than or equal to '1'.",
    ]

post.summary: Create Lab Orders - Requests Lab Orders to be sent to the Quanum Hub after optional approval from PWN
post.description:
## Potential Response Codes + Data

Depending on the input data being sent, there are 3 potential results that will be returned
in the event of a successful call. These scenarios depend on the orders themselves, whether those
orders have previously been sent, and the current status of those orders. 
            
The 3 scenarios are:
            
* All New Orders -- **202 response**
* All Successfully Completed Orders -- **200 response**
* A Mix -- **207 response**
            
Review the Responses for more details
            
## Kit Order Not Required
            
At this point, We do **NOT** require an existing Kit Order  in the System for the Lab Order to be processed.
We decided it provided more flexibility to allow Lab Orders to be placed, regardless.
This could change in the future, however.

200.description:
All Successfully Completed Orders -- Each lab order has been successfully sent to QuanumHub.
The body will contain information about the order, including the PWN Physician Info and Quanum Hub
Confirmation Code.

202.description:
All New Orders -- Each Order requested is new to the system (has not been sent before).
All the requested lab orders are new and being submitted to PWN/Quanum.
The body will be *empty*.

207.description:
A Mix -- A mix of any of the following statuses: new lab orders, resubmitted lab orders (previously errored),
  and completed orders.
Some requested orders are new and being submitted to PWN/Quanum Hub.
Others may be either already shipped (and not re-submitted to PWN/Quanum Hub), or
previously rejected, and are now being re-submitted to PWN/Quanum Hub.
             
The body will contain all the current information the system has, along with
records denoting things that are being "Resubmitted".

400.description:
There are data validation issues.
The body will contain a list of strings describing each validation error
            
    [
      "LabOrderRequest[0].Employer.MedicalDirector.Name.MiddleInitial: The length of 'Middle Initial' must be 1 characters or fewer. You entered 6 characters."
    ]

isBusinessAddress.description: If this is a business address

Ghkoat.Core.Models.ShippingPreferences.description: Specifies the preferences for kit shipment

isTestOrder.description: If this is a test order (used for sending to GBF)

priority.description: 1 is highest priority and 10 is lowest

Ghkoat.Core.Models.Order.description: class used for all incoming kit orders

kitActivationSiteUrl.description:
URL where the user will be redirected when activating a kit
Will have the Kit ID appended to it before redirecting the user's browser window

Ghkoat.Core.Models.Requests.IncomingRequ.description:
Generic status enum used to give status about a singular "request"
like a Kit Order or Lab Order.

shippingClass.description: The Shipping Class (Next Day, 2nd Day, Ground, etc.)

reasonCode.description: Gets or sets the Reason Code

reasonDescription.description: Gets or sets the Reason Description

Ghkoat.Core.Models.Vendor.KitVendorRejec.description: This class represents the Rejection Description and Reason Code from the Kit Vendor

originatingBusinessUnit.description: Gets or sets the Originating Business Unit

submissionCount.description: number of times this record has been submitted

kitShipments.description: The array of successful kit shipments

Ghkoat.Core.Models.KitOrderEntryResponse.description: Represents a single shipped or non-shipped KitOrderEntry Quantity

billingSystemId.description:
BillingSystemId will initially be representative of LID (a guid)
but the meaning of this property may evolve as more BUs join.

Ghkoat.Core.Models.LabOrder.Billing.description: Billing class for future Billing options

pwnOversightRequired.description: Whether or not the lab order should be sent to PWN before Quanum

labOrderRequest.description: NOTE: The singular naming of this property came from EPH. Needs to be renamed eventually

Ghkoat.Core.Models.Requests.LabOrdersReq.description: Top level object that only contains an array of orders

pwnOrderId.description: The order ID for the PWN Order that was created

kitId.description: The Unique Kit ID related to this document

quanumHubConfirmationNumber.description: The Confirmation Number received from Quanum Hub for this Lab Order

exceptionData.description: Exception/Error information received while trying to process this lab order

submissionCount.description: number of times this record has been submitted

errorDescription.description: Description of the error if the Ghkoat.Core.Models.LabOrder.LabOrderResponse.CurrentStatus is "Error"

Ghkoat.Core.Models.LabOrder.LabOrderResp.description: Response sent back to the BU for status about this particular lab order request
